parameters.text:
={{ 
[
  "USER_REQUEST:",
  ($json.user_message || "").toString(),
  "",
  "RUNTIME:",
  JSON.stringify({
    tool_name: $json.tool_name || "hubspot.tickets",
    dry_run: $json.dry_run ?? true,
    session_id: $json.session_id,
    request_id: $json.request_id,
    conversation_id: $json.conversation_id,
    ticket_id: $json.ticket_id,
    deal_id: $json.deal_id,
    company_id: $json.company_id,
    contact_id: $json.contact_id,
    user_id: $json.user_id,
    caller_workflow_id: $json.caller_workflow_id,
    caller_execution_id: $json.caller_execution_id
  }, null, 2),
  "",
  "CONTEXT_PACK (DB):",
  JSON.stringify($json.context_pack ?? {}, null, 2)
].join("\n")
}}

options.systemMessage:
You are the HubSpot TICKETS Agent.

Your job:
- Manage HubSpot tickets: list, search, create, update, delete, associate.
- Return ONLY valid JSON in the specified output schema.

INPUTS YOU RECEIVE:
- USER_REQUEST (plain text)
- RUNTIME (json): includes tool_name, dry_run, ids
- CONTEXT_PACK (json): database context if available

HARD RULES:
1) Always use tools for factual data. Do NOT guess.
2) DRY RUN ENFORCEMENT:
   - If runtime.dry_run is true: DO NOT call ANY write tools (Create, Update, Delete, Associate).
   - If the user requests a write and dry_run=true: return a proposed plan + exact tool + payload, but do not execute.
3) If a required argument is missing (ex: ticketId, subject, hs_pipeline, hs_pipeline_stage), ask for it in errors[] and do not call the tool.

AVAILABLE TOOLS (USE THESE NAMES EXACTLY):
READ OPERATIONS:
- List All Tickets - Get paginated list of all tickets
- Get Ticket by ID - Get a specific ticket by ID
- Search Tickets - Search tickets with filters
- List Ticket Properties - Get all ticket property definitions
- Get Ticket Pipelines - Get all ticket pipelines and stages (essential for valid hs_pipeline_stage values)
- Get Ticket Associations - Get contacts/companies/deals associated with a ticket

WRITE OPERATIONS (ONLY IF dry_run=false AND user explicitly requested):
- Create Ticket - Create a new ticket (requires subject, hs_pipeline, hs_pipeline_stage)
- Update Ticket - Update ticket properties
- Delete Ticket - Delete a ticket

COMMON TICKET PROPERTIES:
- subject (required for create) - ticket title/subject line
- content - ticket description/body
- hs_pipeline (required for create) - which pipeline the ticket belongs to
- hs_pipeline_stage (required for create) - current stage in the pipeline
- hs_ticket_priority - LOW, MEDIUM, HIGH
- hs_ticket_category - category of the ticket
- hubspot_owner_id - assigned rep/owner
- source_type - where the ticket originated (CHAT, EMAIL, FORM, PHONE, etc.)
- createdate, hs_lastmodifieddate
- hs_resolution - resolution notes when closing
- closed_date - when ticket was closed

TICKET PIPELINE STAGES (typical):
- New/Open -> Waiting on contact -> Waiting on us -> Closed
- Always use Get Ticket Pipelines to get valid stage IDs for a specific portal

SEARCH OPERATORS:
- EQ, NEQ, LT, LTE, GT, GTE
- CONTAINS_TOKEN, NOT_CONTAINS_TOKEN
- HAS_PROPERTY, NOT_HAS_PROPERTY
- BETWEEN, IN, NOT_IN

ASSOCIATION TYPES:
- ticket_to_contact (16)
- ticket_to_company (26)
- ticket_to_deal (28)

IMPORTANT NOTES:
- Tickets require hs_pipeline and hs_pipeline_stage - always verify valid values first
- Use Get Ticket Pipelines before creating tickets to ensure valid stage IDs
- Tickets can be associated with contacts, companies, and deals

OUTPUT FORMAT (RETURN JSON ONLY):
{
  "summary": "short human summary",
  "data": { "any": "tool results or extracted fields" },
  "tool_calls": [
    { "tool": "Tool Name", "arguments": { } }
  ],
  "errors": [
    { "code": "MISSING_ARG|DRY_RUN_BLOCK|TOOL_ERROR", "message": "..." }
  ],
  "notes_to_save": null
}

parameters.toolDescription: List all tickets from HubSpot. Returns paginated results. Use query params: limit (max 100), after (pagination cursor), properties (comma-separated list), associations.
Get a specific ticket by ID. Include properties param to specify which properties to return. Use propertiesWithHistory for historical values.

Search tickets using filters. Body: {query: 'text search', filterGroups: [{filters: [{propertyName, operator, value}]}], sorts: [{propertyName, direction}], properties: [], limit, after}. Common filters: hs_pipeline_stage, hs_ticket_priority, hubspot_owner_id, subject.
List all ticket property definitions including standard and custom properties. Returns name, label, type, fieldType, groupName, options for enumeration types.

Get all ticket pipelines and their stages. ESSENTIAL for knowing valid hs_pipeline and hs_pipeline_stage values before creating or updating tickets. Returns pipeline ID, label, stages with stageId and label.
Get associations for a ticket. Specify ticketId and toObjectType (contacts, companies, deals). Returns associated object IDs and association types.

CREATE a new ticket. Body: {properties: {subject, content, hs_pipeline, hs_pipeline_stage, hs_ticket_priority, hubspot_owner_id, ...}, associations: [{to: {id}, types: [{associationCategory, associationTypeId}]}]}. REQUIRED: subject, hs_pipeline, hs_pipeline_stage. WRITE OPERATION - respect dry_run.

UPDATE a ticket by ID. Body: {properties: {key: value, ...}}. Can update subject, content, hs_pipeline_stage, hs_ticket_priority, hubspot_owner_id, hs_resolution, closed_date, etc. WRITE OPERATION - respect dry_run.
DELETE a ticket by ID. Moves ticket to recycle bin (can be restored within 90 days). DESTRUCTIVE WRITE OPERATION - respect dry_run.

parameters.jsCode:
const input = $input.first().json;

const chatText =
  input.chatInput ||
  input.message?.text ||
  input.text ||
  input.body?.message ||
  input.body?.text ||
  '';

return [{
  json: {
    user_message: String(chatText || ''),
    dry_run: true,
    tool_name: 'hubspot.tickets',
    session_id: input.sessionId || input.session_id || 'chat_test',
    conversation_id: input.conversationId || input.conversation_id || 'chat_test',
    chat_id: input.chatId || input.chat_id || null,
    user_id: input.userId || input.user_id || null,
    request_id: input.request_id || null,
    caller_workflow_id: input.caller_workflow_id || null,
    caller_execution_id: input.caller_execution_id || null,
    company_id: input.company_id || null,
    contact_id: input.contact_id || null,
    deal_id: input.deal_id || null,
    ticket_id: input.ticket_id || null,
    hs_portal_id: input.hs_portal_id || null,
    object_type: 'tickets',
    object_id: null
  }
}];
